intro: Annona longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered custard apple, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height. The plant produces large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit, which resembles a custard apple, is edible and has a sweet, creamy texture. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and fruit.
